metadata.title: CVE-2021-3760 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free vulnerability in theNFC stack can lead to a threat to confidentiality, integrity, and systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-azure - 4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1').
